Package com.pizzeria.training.controllers

Class CustomerController

java.lang.Object
com.pizzeria.training.controllers.CustomerController
@RestController
@CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:3000")
@RequestMapping("/customers")
public class CustomerController
extends java.lang.Object
REST controller class for Customer object to interact with mongoDB database

    • newCustomer

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Customer> newCustomer​(@RequestBody Customer newCustomer) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Post method to add a customer to the database
      Parameters:
      newCustomer - New customer object to be added
      Returns:
      Saves new customer to Database
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • getCustomers

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Customer>> getCustomers​(@RequestParam(required=false) org.bson.types.ObjectId _id, @RequestParam(required=false) java.lang.String city)
      Get method for all customers in the database
      Parameters:
      _id - Optional parameter to filter by customer Id
      city - Optional parameter to filter by city of residence
      Returns:
      List of all customers in the database

    • getAllCustomersByExample

      @PostMapping("/examples") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Customer>> getAllCustomersByExample​(@RequestBody Customer customer)
      Get method for customers using an example customer object
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer to be used as an example
      Returns:
      Customers matching the given example

    • updateCustomer

      @PutMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Customer> updateCustomer​(@RequestParam org.bson.types.ObjectId _id, @RequestBody Customer updatedCustomer) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Put method for updating customer information
      Parameters:
      _id - MongoDB document Id to identify customer to edit
      updatedCustomer - New customer object to replace the one currently under the Id
      Returns:
      Saves updated customer in the database
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • deleteCustomer

      @DeleteMapping public void deleteCustomer​(@RequestParam org.bson.types.ObjectId _id)
      Delete method for removing a customer from the database
      Parameters:
      _id - The customer to be deleted's Id

      The correctly cased string
